item.title: Restoring The Missing B 5000 Manual
item.description: The B 5000 mainframe computer was the first in a series of special machines released by the Burroughs Corporation. A stack machine with relative memory addressing, tagged architecture and a single-pass Algol compiler, the B 5000 was designed to make software development easier. I first heard about it watching Alan Kay’s Vannevar Bush lecture. As I was researching the machine, I found several references to “The Descriptor”; a technical manual that Burroughs supplied for the B 5000.
